metadata.title: CVE-2023-52581 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:netfilter: nf_tables: fix memleak when more than 255 elements expired Whenmore than 255 elements expired we're supposed to switch to a new gccontainer structure. This never happens: u8 type will wrap before reachingthe boundary and nft_trans_gc_space() always returns true. This means werecycle the initial gc container structure and lose track of the elementsthat came before. While at it, don't deref 'gc' after we've passed it tocall_rcu.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52581` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.6.0-14-generic - 6.6.0-14.14
linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-14-generic - 6.6.0-14.14
linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-14-generic-64k - 6.6.0-14.14
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-1001-aws - 6.6.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-1001-azure - 6.6.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-1001-gcp - 6.6.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-14-lowlatency - 6.6.0-14.14.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-14-lowlatency-64k - 6.6.0-14.14.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-1001-oracle - 6.6.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-aws package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.6.0-1001.1').

linux-ibm package in noble is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '6.6.0-1001.1').
linux-lowlatency package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.6.0-14.14.1').
linux-oracle package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.6.0-1001.1').
linux-raspi package in noble is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '6.7.0-1001.1').
